body: Thanks @afchung I addressed your comments. Please take another look.
I'm doing a pass now.
I have done a pass with a focus on the design considerations. I'd like to do another one once that discussion has converged.
Any way to add a test case for the scenario?
LGTM. Will test and merge.
tests pass, will merge.
I've done a pass.

@jwang98052 I wasn't able to find an easy way to add tests that test the negative scenario without adding ugly hooks inside the Driver code to delay the `DONE` message. Would be great if you have ideas on how to do it.
This was originally discovered via a functional test for broadcast/reduce on the C# side, but the behavior was not deterministic either.
LGTM, will test and merge
@markusweimer I have addressed your review comments.
@markusweimer @jwang98052 I've addressed your comments. Please have another look. Thanks!

I've addressed the comments and pushed rebased version

@dkm2110 I'm reluctant to read multiple evaluator logs to verify inputs of functions. First, tests should verify outputs, not inputs, and ideally as Assert in the test task itself instead of logs. Second, our current infrastructure supports reading at most 1 log for verification, and I'd rather invest effort into new infrastructure that would not be log-based (we have a JIRA for that) than in adding more log reading. Let's keep this as is for now

@markusweimer @jwang98052 I have done changes as per review. Additionally I moved the whole logic of checking for master vs mapper etc. to the Configuration provider class. Also I rmeoved TaskId stack as per conversation but could not check code with this change since it seems REEF mught be currently broken (atleast I cannot run either on yarn or local). Once I get reviews and reef is up again I will retest with 1000 evaluators.

Also I had to do a rebase to incorporate some latest commits which I needed here. For example related to log being always printed in Verbose so that I could check the logs of 1000 nodes and check that things are fine.
@jwang98052  I have taken a pass.
@johnyangk just a few more comments, otherwise looks good to me.
I see OK. I do not have objection then.
@afchung Thanks, I pushed another commit to address them.
@dkm2110 I have addressed your comments.
@dkm2110 @jwang98052 Can you please review this and merge if there are no other comments?
Looks good, I'll test and merge.
I'll test and merge. I want these tests in to avoid the kind of situation we currently discuss on the list :)
Yes, it is my wish also :-) Thank you!
It might take a while, as I want to run the tests several times. Just to be sure.
@jwang98052 done with a first pass.

I had one test failure in 4 runs. The html report contained this summary:

```
Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.IMRU.IMRUMapperCountTest.TestIMRUMapperCountOnLocalRuntime

Expected number of contexts to close (4) differs from actual number of success indicators (8)\r\nExpected: True\r\nActual:   False

   at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.ReefFunctionalTest.ValidateSuccessForLocalRuntime(Int32 numberOfContextsToClose, Int32 numberOfTasksToFail, Int32 numberOfEvaluatorsToFail, String testFolder) in D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Functional\ReefFunctionalTest.cs:line 179
   at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.IMRU.IMRUMapperCountTest.TestIMRUMapperCountOnLocalRuntime() in D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Functional\IMRU\IMRUMapperCountTest.cs:line 38
```
Done with a first pass.
One more data point: I did not recompile the project between runs. This means that the non-determinism isn't in the build process, but the tests themselves.

Interesting.
@dkm2110 You know this code best. Is it possible that sometimes IMRU opens two contexts per evaluator? Or requests more evaluators than configured?
Done with a pass.
Update on my test runs: I had 1 failure in 8 runs so far.
@afchung I have addressed your review comments.

Mariia

Nothing like this should happen. However, I fear there might be some stream
closing issues leading to failures. REEF-1224 should address that.

Dhruv

Tests pass 10 times in a row. Given that the frequency I hit this issue before was 1-in-4 runs, I think it is safe to merge this. Will merge.
@afchung addressed your review comments. Thanks!
@afchung update checked in.

Several notes related to creating new test project.
1. Why is there no packages.config? All other test projects have their own, even if packages declared in them duplicate the ones imported by other projects.
2. With the current state of AppVeyor config, we need to list each test project so that it gets executed. Please add a line to appveyor.yml similar to other projects, so that we can verify there's no issue with these tests manifests in AppVeyor only.
@markusweimer @jwang98052 created new pull request for this: https://github.com/apache/reef/pull/952..Sorry for the inconvenience.
@markusweimer @jwang98052  this is the new pull request that should replace https://github.com/apache/reef/pull/939. Sorry for the inconvenience.
@tcNickolas I have addressed your review comments.

That didn't seem to have worked :(

I've also done a pass. I agree with @dkm2110, we should apply a spell checker before merging. 

Code wise, I have another question: All the new types introduced here are `public` and in the `Driver` project. Given that the purpose of these new types is to model the state transitions in the IMRU Driver, I wonder whether they shouldn't be in the `IMRU` project and marked `internal` to keep our API surface small.

Thoughts?
@markusweimer  sorry was on mobile. Closed actually. Please review https://github.com/apache/reef/pull/952
Similar to #938, I'd suggest to move all this code into the `IMRU` project and to make it `internal`, as these states can only be understood in the context of IMRU.
I'm done with a first pass. @markusweimer feel free to have a pass.

@afchung  I agree with your major higher level issues/comments. However, I was not sure whether to do all that in this PR or not given @jwang98052  wanted to do some of these refactorings/changes at her end. @markusweimer please share your thoughts also at some of @afchung  concerns.

Thanks @dkm2110, I think you and @markusweimer are better judges of that, given that I'm not too familiar with the code yet. I'll do a pass on the logic after @markusweimer's review and your next revision. Thanks!
LGTM, will test and merge
@dongjoon-hyun Sorry I missed your ping. I'll review and merge.

No problem. Thank you for review, @johnyangk !

@markusweimer  @afchung  I have addressed most of your comments. Please have a look.

If we want to make those classes internal before it is mature, we can put it inside IMRU project. If eventually they will be public as they are basically generic, we can leave them in this name space. 
I think TaskClosedByDriver is still generic. What is not generic is TaskFailedByGroupCommunication.
LGTM, will test and merge.
Done a pass.
@dkm2110 done with another pass. Overall the changes seem fine for this JIRA item, but I think the documentation and code structure can be improved for IMRU.

Expected number of contexts to close (4) differs from actual number of success indicators (16)\r\nExpected: True\r\nActual:   False

This seems unrelated. Let me try again.

This is unrelated but actually interesting. We've seen this failure first at #940, and filed REEF-1338 for it which is now resolved, so this issue should also be gone. Do you have a driver log from this failure to show to @dkm2110 ?

> Do you have a driver log from this failure to show to @dkm2110 ?

No, sorry. I was too trigger-happy with the clean...

Since this should be unrelated to the change, you'll probably get this failure again at some point. Could you show it to @dkm2110 the next time you see it? It being IMRU, we really want to track it down.
I've addressed the comments and updated PR
